field.label: Description
field.help: Short description to identify this server

field.label: Hostname / IP
field.help: The server's IP or hostname to connect to

field.label: Port
field.help: The port (UDP/TCP) to connect to. If omitted, UDP and TCP will default to 1812 while TLS and DTLS will default to 2083.

field.label: Status-Server
field.help: Enable the use of status-server messages for this server (default off). If statusserver is enabled (on), the proxy will send regular status-server messages to the server to verify that it is alive. Status tracking of the server will solely depend on status-server message and ignore lost requests. This should only be enabled if the server supports it. With the option minimal status-server messages are only sent when regular requests have been lost and no other replies have been received.

field.label: Type
field.help: Choose the type of server. Default Radius-clients use UDP.

field.label: Secret
field.help: The shared RADIUS key with this server. This option is optional for TLS/DTLS and if omitted will default to "radsec". (Note that using a secret other than "radsec" for TLS is a violation of the standard (RFC 6614) and that the proposed standard for DTLS stipulates that the secret must be "radius/dtls".)

field.label: TLS-Config
field.help: For a TLS/DTLS client you may also specify the tls option. The option value must be the name of a previously defined TLS block. If this option is not specified, the TLS block with the name defaultClient or default will be used if defined (in that order). If the specified TLS block name does not exist, or the option is not specified and none of the defaults exist, the proxy will exit with an error.

field.label: Certificate-Name-Check
field.help: For a TLS/DTLS server, disable the default behaviour of matching CN or SubjectAltName against the specified hostname or IP address.

field.label: Match Certificate-Attribute
field.help: Perform additional validation of certificate attributes (CN | SubjectAltName:URI | SubjectAltName:DNS). Currently matching of CN and SubjectAltName types URI DNS and IP is supported. Note that currently this option can only be specified once in a client block.

field.label: Custom settings
field.help: Freetext-settings which will be pasted unvalidated into the block of this server's setting. Be careful!
